actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-666, by Mr. Woodall.
Resolution also provides suspension authority through July 8, 2016.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 132.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 803.

POSTPONED PROCEEDING - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 803, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 180 (Roll no. 352).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 240 - 182 (Roll no. 353).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4361) to amend section 3554 of title 44, United States Code, to provide for enhanced security of Federal information systems, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4361) to amend section 3554 of title 44, United States Code, to provide for enhanced security of Federal information systems, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.
